item.title: Olivia Rodrigo gives Paramore a writing credit on Good 4 U
item.description: Fans had noticed the similarity between Rodrigo's song and Paramore's Misery Business.

item.title: Kanye West files to officially change name to Ye
item.description: It's taken three years since the rapper first announced the change.

item.title: Nirvana sued by the baby from Nevermind's album cover
item.description: Spencer Elden, who was photographed as a four month-old, is alleging child pornography.

item.title: Edinburgh's George IV Bridge fire: Footage shows fire carnage inside 'Harry Potter café'
item.description: The Elephant House café was close to the source of a major fire in one of Edinburgh's main thoroughfares.

item.title: Latitude Festival: More than 1,000 attendees test positive for Covid
item.description: Government figures show more than 400 people were probably infectious at the time of the event.

item.title: OnlyFans suspends policy change after backlash
item.description: The platform had sparked controversy when it revealed plans to ban sex workers from its platform.

item.title: Sir Lenny Henry: Survey shows racism is a stain on entertainment industry
item.description: The star speaks as a survey says 55% of minority performers have experienced racism at work.

item.title: Reading Festival: Teens will be emotional, says boss
item.description: More than 100,000 revellers are expected to attend the attend the event in Reading.

item.title: LS Lowry: Man to auction painting 40 years after father
item.description: Murray Keefe will oversee bidding for the LS Lowry painting which his father sold in 1980.

item.title: Charlie Watts: Jagger and Richards pay tribute to Rolling Stones bandmate
item.description: The Rolling Stones' Mick Jagger and Keith Richards salute drummer Charlie Watts, who has died aged 80.

item.title: Scottish artist Dame Elizabeth Blackadder dies, aged 89
item.description: Tributes are paid to one of Scotland's greatest painters after her death at the age of 89.

item.title: Charlie Watts: The subtle magnificence of the Rolling Stones' drummer
item.description: He wasn't flashy or prone to pyrotechnics, but Charlie Watts was the heartbeat of the Rolling Stones.

item.title: Love Island: Is the dating show's honeymoon phase over?
item.description: The ITV show sparked record complaints, so as the latest series ends, is the magic starting to fade?

item.title: Charlie Watts: The life of a Rolling Stone in pictures
item.description: A look back at the life of the iconic rock 'n' roll drummer, who has died at the age of 80.

item.title: Clive Myrie: Becoming host of Mastermind is a big, big job
item.description: The journalist may be feeling jittery about his new role but hopes it will reveal his lighter side.

item.title: Charlie Watts obituary: Jazz man who became rock superstar
item.description: The drummer kept his feet firmly on the ground despite the success of the Rolling Stones.

item.title: Barakat: First South African film in Cape Town's Afrikaans dialect
item.description: Barakat, or blessing, is the first film in Afrikaaps - a dialect of Afrikaans spoken in Cape Town.

item.title: Cinema box office takings at 50% of pre-pandemic levels
item.description: Box office takings in the past month are half of their pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Charlie Watts: The Who and Chili Peppers drummers pay tribute
item.description: The Who's Kenney Jones and Red Hot Chili Peppers' Chad Smith pay tribute to the Rolling Stones drummer.

item.title: 'Tom Cruise is in my Warwickshire garden'
item.description: A request to land a helicopter carrying an unnamed VIP leads to an encounter with Hollywood royalty.

item.title: Green Man: Festival returns in the Welsh mountains after Covid restrictions
item.description: Wales' largest music festival, Green Man, returns with 25,000 people in attendance.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: You may go to the ball: Cinderella opens in the West End
item.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Emerald Fennel’s reimagining of the classic fairytale debuts in London.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Video games and the making of Free Guy
item.description: Actor and producer Ryan Reynolds on preparing to play a character caught up in a multiplayer game.
